adjective.description: Conveying, implying, or having the character of a promise; especially (Grammar) designating a verbal mood which expresses a promise.

origin: Mid 17th century; earliest use found in Naunton's Fragmenta Regalia. From post-classical Latin promissivus conveying, implying, or having the character of a promise from classical Latin prōmiss-, past participial stem of prōmittere + -īvus.
